result.title: Mod operator strange behaviour
result.content:
Hi guys!

Well, I was solving an easy problem (779B â€” Weird Rounding) 779B - Weird Rounding when I stumbled upon a problem that I don't know how to solve.

Apparently the % operator behaves in a strange way in this case:

if((long int)(s % (long int)pow(10, k)) == 0)
            break;

I need to check if long int s divided by ten to the power of k has remainder zero: even if it seems to satisfy the condition (i.e. s = 10200, (int)(pow(10, 2) = 100) it returns values like 3 or 6. I use g++ on my machine to compile code, and it behaves normally on it.

I don't even know if this is the right spot to ask for this, and if I need to know something additional on how the compiler used by codeforces works.

Thanks in advance!
